required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Atomoxetine and Placebo in Children With Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) and/or Reading Disorder (RD)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Crossover Comparison of Atomoxetine and Placebo in Child Outpatients With Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Reading Disorder, or Comorbid Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder and Reading Disorder.

brief_summary.textblock: To test the hypothesis that a 4 week treatment with atomoxetine is more effective than placebo in patients with combined type Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD), patients with only Reading Disorder, and patients with combined type ADHD and Reading Disorder.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Stop Signal Reaction Time (SSRT) as Derived From the Stop Signal Reaction Time Paradigm
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 4 of initial therapy and Week 4 of crossover therapy
primary_outcome.description: SSRT measures response execution (go trials) and response inhibition (stop trials). Go trials consist of stimulus (airplane). Child to press response button corresponding to direction airplane is pointing. Stop trials consist of go trial and audible stop signal. Initial delay between go trial and stop signal = 250 msec. If child succeeded in inhibiting response, delay on next stop trial increased by 50 msec, otherwise, delay decreased by 50 msec. SSRT = subtract mean delay from mean go signal reaction time. Lower scores mean better ability to suppress response when presented with stop signal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean Stop Signal Reaction Time Comparison of ADHD-C to Normal Control Group in >=10 Year Old Subset
secondary_outcome.description: SSRT measures response execution (go trials) and response inhibition (stop trials). Go trials consist of stimulus (airplane). Child to press response button corresponding to direction airplane is pointing. Stop trials consist of go trial and audible stop signal. Initial delay between go trial and stop signal = 250 msec. If child succeeded in inhibiting response, delay on next stop trial increased by 50 msec, otherwise, delay decreased by 50 msec. SSRT = subtract mean delay from mean go signal reaction time. Lower scores mean better ability to suppress response when presented with stop signal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean Stop Signal Reaction Time Comparison of ADHD-C+RD and RD to Reading Disordered Control Group in >=10 Year Old Subset
secondary_outcome.description: SSRT measures response execution (go trials) and response inhibition (stop trials). Go trials consist of stimulus (airplane). Child to press response button corresponding to direction airplane is pointing. Stop trials consist of go trial and audible stop signal. Initial delay between go trial and stop signal = 250 msec. If child succeeded in inhibiting response, delay on next stop trial increased by 50 msec, otherwise, delay decreased by 50 msec. SSRT = subtract mean delay from mean go signal reaction time. Lower scores mean better ability to suppress response when presented with stop signal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lexical Decision Task Mean Reaction Time: Correct Words
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 4 of initial therapy and Week 4 of crossover therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of reaction time to identify whether a word displayed on a computer is a real or correct word versus a pseudo word. During the performance of the lexical decision task that was presented on a computer, the reaction times and accuracy of responses were measured. Data presented are the mean reaction times over the 4 weeks of each therapy for identifying correct words correctly.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lexical Decision Task Mean Reaction Time: Pseudo Words
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 4 of initial therapy and Week 4 of crossover therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of reaction time to identify whether a word displayed on a computer is a pseudo word versus a real or correct word. During the performance of the lexical decision task that was presented on a computer, the reaction times and accuracy of responses were measured. Data presented are the mean reaction times over the 4 weeks of each therapy for identifying pseudo words correctly.

secondary_outcome.measure: Working Memory by Corsi Block Tapping Test (CBTT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 4 of initial therapy and Week 4 of crossover therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Measures the visuo-spatial working memory span, and corresponds to the longest sequence of blocks that has been reproduced correctly at least once. Scores can range from 3 to 8, with the higher score indicating better function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-IV-Parent Version: Investigator-Administered and Scored - Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 4 of initial therapy and Week 4 of crossover therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Measures the 18 symptoms contained in the DSM-IV diagnosis of Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder. Individual item scores range from 0 (none/never or rarely) to 3 (severe/very often). Total score is the sum of the scores on the 18 items and range from 0 to 54.

secondary_outcome.measure: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-IV-Parent Version: Investigator-Administered and Scored - Inattention Subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 4 of initial therapy and Week 4 of crossover therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Measures the degree of inattention symptoms based on answers to 9 items. Individual item scores range from 0 (none/never or rarely) to 3 (severe/very often), for a total Inattention Subscale score range of 0 to 27.

secondary_outcome.measure: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-IV-Parent Version: Investigator-Administered and Scored - Hyperactivity-Impulsivity Subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 4 of initial therapy and Week 4 of crossover therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Measures the degree of hyperactivity-impulsivity symptoms, based on answers to 9 items. Individual item scores range from 0 (none/never or rarely) to 3 (severe/very often) for a total Hyperactivity-Impulsivity Subscale score of 0 to 27.

secondary_outcome.measure: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-IV-Parent Version: Investigator-Administered and Scored - Total T-Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 4 of initial therapy and Week 4 of crossover therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Measures the 18 symptoms contained in the DSM-IV diagnosis of Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder. Individual item scores range from 0 (none/never or rarely) to 3 (severe/very often). Total score is computed as the sum of the scores on each of the 18 items. Total score is the sum of the scores on the 18 items and range from 0 to 54. Total T-score = (Total Score - 50)/10. Total T-score ranges from -5 (low severity) to 0.4 (high severity).

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impression-Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder-Improvement Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Measures total improvement (or worsening) of a patient's ADHD symptoms from the beginning of treatment (1=very much improved, 7=very much worsened).

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impression-Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder-Severity Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Measures severity of the patient's overall severity of ADHD symptoms (1=normal, not at all ill; 7=among the most extremely ill patients).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Phonological Task Mean Reaction Time Comparison of ADHD-C to Normal Control Group in >=10 Year Old Subset: Pseudohomophones
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of reaction time in determining whether the stimulus sounds like a real word ('yes' response) or not ('no' response) using pseudohomophones and pseudo words. Data presented here are for reaction time to identifying psuedohomophones correctly.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Phonological Task Mean Reaction Time Comparison of ADHD-C to Normal Control Group in >=10 Year Old Subset: Pseudo Words
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of reaction time in determining whether the stimulus sounds like a real word ('yes' response) or not ('no' response) using pseudo homophones and pseudo words. Data presented here are for reaction time to identifying pseudo words correctly.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Phonological Task Mean Reaction Time Comparison of ADHD-C+RD and RD to Reading Disordered Control Group in >=10 Year Old Subset: Pseudohomophones
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of reaction time in determining whether the stimulus sounds like a real word ('yes' response) or not ('no' response) using pseudo homophones and pseudo words. Data presented here are for reaction time to identifying psuedohomophones correctly.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Phonological Task Mean Reaction Time Comparison of ADHD-C+RD and RD to Reading Disordered Control Group in >=10 Year Old Subset: Pseudo Words
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of reaction time in determining whether the stimulus sounds like a real word ('yes' response) or not ('no' response) using pseudo homophones and pseudo words. Data presented here are for reaction time to indentifying pseudo words correctly.

arm_group.description: Atomoxetine, 1.2 mg/kg/day, by mouth (PO) for 4 weeks, 2 week washout period and cross-over to placebo, every day (QD), PO for 4 weeks
Placebo, every day (QD), by mouth (PO) for 4 weeks, 2 week washout period and cross-over to atomoxetine 1.2 mg/kg/day, PO for 4 weeks

Normal controls were children selected from the general population. The normal control was matched (have same proportion) by sex (male/female) and by age (have same age range) as the study population.
The reading disordered control group is comprised of children with reading disorder who receive standard remedial teaching therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis with Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder and/or Reading Disorder
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with Conduct Disorder
- Patients who have a history of Bipolar I or II Disorder, psychosis, or Pervasive Development Disorder.
- Patients who have a current diagnosis of Vocal Tic Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, Major Depressive Disorder, Post Traumatic Stress Disorder, Anxiety Disorder, and certain other learning disorders.

For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.

For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.

For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.

For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Period I: screening/washout (89 patients screened, 13 screen-failures;45 controls screened). Period II (Visits 2-5): patients received treatment for 4 weeks and then underwent 2-week washout period after which they crossed over to receive the alternate treatment for 4 additional weeks. Period III (Visits 6-12): optional open-label (1 country only).

group.title: Atomoxetine First, Then Placebo
group.description: Atomoxetine 1.2 mg/kg/day, by mouth for 4 weeks, 2 week washout period and then cross-over to placebo, every day, by mouth for 4 weeks.

group.title: Placebo First, Then Atomoxetine
group.description: Placebo every day, by mouth for 4 weeks, 2 week washout period and then cross-over to atomoxetine 1.2 mg/kg/day, by mouth for 4 weeks.

group.title: Normal Control
group.description: Untreated normal controls were children selected from the general population. The normal control was matched (have same proportion) by sex (male/female) and by age (have same age range) as the study population.

group.title: Reading Disordered Control
group.description: Untreated reading disordered control group was comprised of children with reading disorder who received standard remedial teaching therapy.

participants_list.participants: These are patients who continued in optional open-label period (1 country). All received atomoxetine
These are patients who continued in optional open-label period (1 country). All received atomoxetine

group.title: Atomoxetine First, Then Placebo
group.description: Atomoxetine 1.2 mg/kg/day for 4 weeks, 2 week washout, and then placebo for 4 weeks

group.title: Placebo First, Then Atomoxetine
group.description: Placebo for 4 weeks, 2 week washout, and then atomoxetine 1.2 mg/kg/day for 4 weeks.

group.title: Normal Control
group.description: Untreated normal controls were children selected from the general population. The normal control was matched (have same proportion) by sex (male/female) and by age (have same age range) as the study population.

group.title: Reading Disordered Control
group.description: Untreated reading disordered control group was comprised of children with reading disorder who received standard remedial teaching therapy.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Stop Signal Reaction Time (SSRT) as Derived From the Stop Signal Reaction Time Paradigm
outcome.description: SSRT measures response execution (go trials) and response inhibition (stop trials). Go trials consist of stimulus (airplane). Child to press response button corresponding to direction airplane is pointing. Stop trials consist of go trial and audible stop signal. Initial delay between go trial and stop signal = 250 msec. If child succeeded in inhibiting response, delay on next stop trial increased by 50 msec, otherwise, delay decreased by 50 msec. SSRT = subtract mean delay from mean go signal reaction time. Lower scores mean better ability to suppress response when presented with stop signal.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 4 of initial therapy and Week 4 of crossover therapy
outcome.population: All efficacy information is summarized and/or presented in data listings based on the Safety sample: Includes all patients who were randomized to double-blind treatment and received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: Atomoxetine
group.description: Atomoxetine, 1.2 mg/kg/day, by mouth for 4 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo, daily, by mouth for 4 weeks.

measure.title: Stop Signal Reaction Time (SSRT) as Derived From the Stop Signal Reaction Time Paradigm
measure.description: SSRT measures response execution (go trials) and response inhibition (stop trials). Go trials consist of stimulus (airplane). Child to press response button corresponding to direction airplane is pointing. Stop trials consist of go trial and audible stop signal. Initial delay between go trial and stop signal = 250 msec. If child succeeded in inhibiting response, delay on next stop trial increased by 50 msec, otherwise, delay decreased by 50 msec. SSRT = subtract mean delay from mean go signal reaction time. Lower scores mean better ability to suppress response when presented with stop signal.
measure.population: All efficacy information is summarized and/or presented in data listings based on the Safety sample: Includes all patients who were randomized to double-blind treatment and received at least one dose of study drug.

analysis.groups_desc: Least Squares Mean (LSMean) values were calculated from the measurements taken at baseline and at the end of each 4 week therapy period.
analysis.p_value_desc: P-value for Overall. No adjustments for multiple comparisons - not applicable. All statistical tests were performed using a 0.05 significance level.
analysis.method_desc: Repeated measures model including terms for baseline, study arm, treatment sequence, visit, treatment, and treatment-by-study-arm interaction.

outcome.title: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-IV-Parent Version: Investigator-Administered and Scored - Total T-Score
outcome.description: Measures the 18 symptoms contained in the DSM-IV diagnosis of Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder. Individual item scores range from 0 (none/never or rarely) to 3 (severe/very often). Total score is computed as the sum of the scores on each of the 18 items. Total score is the sum of the scores on the 18 items and range from 0 to 54. Total T-score = (Total Score - 50)/10. Total T-score ranges from -5 (low severity) to 0.4 (high severity).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 4 of initial therapy and Week 4 of crossover therapy
outcome.population: All efficacy information is summarized and/or presented in data listings based on the Safety sample: Includes all patients who were randomized to double-blind treatment and received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: Atomoxetine
group.description: Atomoxetine, 1.2 mg/kg/day, by mouth for 4 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo, daily, by mouth for 4 weeks.

measure.title: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-IV-Parent Version: Investigator-Administered and Scored - Total T-Score
measure.description: Measures the 18 symptoms contained in the DSM-IV diagnosis of Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder. Individual item scores range from 0 (none/never or rarely) to 3 (severe/very often). Total score is computed as the sum of the scores on each of the 18 items. Total score is the sum of the scores on the 18 items and range from 0 to 54. Total T-score = (Total Score - 50)/10. Total T-score ranges from -5 (low severity) to 0.4 (high severity).
measure.population: All efficacy information is summarized and/or presented in data listings based on the Safety sample: Includes all patients who were randomized to double-blind treatment and received at least one dose of study drug.
measure.units: T-Score of units on a scale

analysis.groups_desc: Least Squares Mean (LSMean) values were calculated from the measurements taken at baseline and at the end of each 4 week therapy period.
analysis.p_value_desc: P-value for Overall. There were no adjustments for multiple comparisons - not applicable. All statistical tests were performed using a 0.05 significance level.
analysis.method_desc: Repeated measures model including terms for baseline, study arm, treatment sequence, visit, treatment, and treatment-by-study-arm interaction.

outcome.title: Clinical Global Impression-Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder-Improvement Scale
outcome.description: Measures total improvement (or worsening) of a patient's ADHD symptoms from the beginning of treatment (1=very much improved, 7=very much worsened).
outcome.population: All efficacy information is summarized and/or presented in data listings based on the Safety sample: Includes all patients who were randomized to double-blind treatment and received at least one dose of study drug.

outcome.population: All efficacy information is summarized and/or presented in data listings based on the Safety sample: Includes all patients who were randomized to double-blind treatment and received at least one dose of study drug.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Phonological Task Mean Reaction Time Comparison of ADHD-C to Normal Control Group in >=10 Year Old Subset: Pseudohomophones
outcome.description: Measure of reaction time in determining whether the stimulus sounds like a real word ('yes' response) or not ('no' response) using pseudohomophones and pseudo words. Data presented here are for reaction time to identifying psuedohomophones correctly.
outcome.population: All efficacy information is summarized and/or presented in data listings based on the Safety sample: Includes all patients who were randomized to double-blind treatment and received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: ADHD-C
group.description: atomoxetine-treated Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder-Combined Type

group.title: Normal Control
group.description: Untreated normal controls were children selected from the general population. The normal control was matched (have same proportion) by sex (male/female) and by age (have same age range) as the study population.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Phonological Task Mean Reaction Time Comparison of ADHD-C to Normal Control Group in >=10 Year Old Subset: Pseudohomophones
measure.description: Measure of reaction time in determining whether the stimulus sounds like a real word ('yes' response) or not ('no' response) using pseudohomophones and pseudo words. Data presented here are for reaction time to identifying psuedohomophones correctly.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
